image.altText: 'Welcome to Genius Gungahlin' sign on a building.

props.synopsis: Genius Childcare centre in Gungahlin will be temporarily shut down by the ACT regulator after it received a spate of reports about child health and safety breaches.

title.children: Canberra childcare temporarily shut 'in the best interest of children'

image.altText: A bottle sites on the beach with mussels attached to it and a dark purple sky behind.

props.synopsis: Australian historians couldn't believe it when they found a clue about one of the world's oldest messages in a bottle.

title.children: Clue found to Australia's earliest message in a bottle

image.altText: A bird's head pokes out from a wrapped towel.

props.synopsis: Community volunteers have set up a hospital in a country New South Wales showground to triage and treat hundreds of birds injured during a hailstorm earlier this week.

title.children: Town goes quiet as hundreds of birds killed or injured in hailstorm

image.altText: A young woman in a gym wearing blue bike pants and crop top, lunging with a weighted bag on her back.

props.synopsis: Thousands of social media followers are trying out the hybrid training model, but experts say the intense training style can be harmful, if not done correctly.Â

title.children: Hyrox training is trending on social media, but it's not new in the gym

image.altText: A large housing construction site with multiple excavators on the edge of a bush block.

props.synopsis: The second stage of Canberra suburb Denman Prospect was set to be built on Bluetts Block in the Molonglo Valley, but it has now been declared a nature reserve to preserve its ecological value.

title.children: 'Lovely piece of bushland' at Canberra's edge spared from development

image.altText: Two men in an office monitoring traffic on a large video board.

props.synopsis: Road authorities are urging Canberra drivers to avoid taking illegal and potentially dangerous shortcuts to avoid increased peak hour traffic due to the closure of the western side of London Circuit for light rail construction.

title.children: Traffic congestion prompts ACT authorities to take action on illegal driving

image.altText: A man with a handlebar moustache smiles while holding the handles of a penny farthing.

props.synopsis: Perched atop a penny farthing while playing classical guitar, Simon Weir is something of a local celebrity in Canberra â and now he's preparing to compete at the National Penny Farthing Championships.

title.children: Penny farthing while playing guitar helps Simon prepare for championships

image.altText: A Hillcrest Primary School sign with hundreds of bunches of flowers arranged on the ground nearby, a

props.synopsis: In November last year, the Devonport Magistrates Court heard two weeks of detailed evidence into how the Hillcrest Primary School tragedy unfolded. The accused and the victims' families return to court today as lawyers make their closing submissions.

title.children: Hillcrest tragedy criminal case nears end as families return to court

image.altText: Albanese wears a high-vis vest and white hard hat on a construction site with others.

props.synopsis: Labor has long held these outer-suburban electorates in Australia's mortgage belts. Tomorrow's Reserve Bank interest rate decision will heavily shape the party's hold on them.

title.children: Suburban Melbourne and Perth home to nation's most indebted electorates

image.altText: Macro Rubio and Benjamin Netanyahu shake hands behind podiums after a press conference.

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu made the comments alongside US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, a day after his country received a shipment of American made heavy bombs.

title.children: Phase two of Gaza ceasefire looms as Israeli PM vows 'hell' if truce ends

image.altText: Pamela Anderson smiles while wearing a diamond chocker necklace and white off-the-shoulder-dress

props.synopsis: The red carpet has been rolled out and the stars have arrived for the UK film industry's biggest night of the year: the British Academy Film Awards.Â

title.children: Stars serve glamour on the BAFTAs red carpet

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: At least one commanding officer has challenged Defence Minister Richard Marles's decision to strip commanders of medals over the conduct of soldiers in Afghanistan.

title.children: Delays expected as Australian soldier challenges loss of war medals

image.altText: A man stands on a vacant lot next to a for sale sign.

props.synopsis: Authorities say Henry Luiz cannot build on his coastal block due to climate change, but he's still expected to pay rates and land tax.

title.children: Flood overlay changes kill couple's dream house plan for retirement

image.altText: Chief commissioner of Victoria Police Shane Patton

props.synopsis: Shane Patton exits from the top job after a vote of no-confidence in his leadership earlier this week, with the emergency management chief to act in his role.

title.children: Victoria's police chief commissioner resigns after vote of no-confidence

image.altText: A photo of Alyssia with her blonde hair in a bun, wearing black glasses. She's holding a notebook and pen.

props.synopsis: Think you've mastered adulthood? Alyssia Moolenschot, who runs a program that helps young people navigate life after school, wants to put your practical knowledge to the test.Â

title.children: How many basic life skills do you have? Try our pop quiz to find out

image.altText: Close up shot of a woman's hands clasped on a lap

props.synopsis: Mental health nurse Amanda once felt intense anxiety when driving into work, but after several years of frequent assaults, her dread has morphed into anger.

title.children: 'I hate it': Mental health nurse's anxiety over work turns to anger

image.altText: Joseph Suaalii running the ball for the Waratahs against the Highlanders.

props.synopsis: With the Wallabies' series against the British and Irish Lions on the horizon, Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii gives a glimpse of his enormous potential as the Super Rugby Pacific season kicks off.

title.children: Suaalii is a work in progress but the hype is real after Waratahs debut

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Dutton smiles, sitting in parliament with his arms crossed

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal the results of YouGov's latest MRP model, which finds the Peter Dutton-led Coalition would be likely to win about 73 seats if an election was held today.

title.children: Albanese in trouble as polling shows Dutton most likely to be next PM

image.altText: Barry Urban stands in Parliament, holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: WA Labor MP Barry Urban dies three months after being allegedly attacked at a tyre business he manages.Â

title.children: Disgraced former Labor MP Barry Urban dies months after alleged attack

image.altText: Snow in mountains.

props.synopsis: Victoria receives a "temperature whiplash" with summer snow and record cold temperatures after days of heatwave conditions.

title.children: Summer snow as Victoria experiences coldest February night on record

image.altText: A fire burning precariously close to homes in Dunsborough.

props.synopsis: Authorities have downgraded a bushfire emergency warning to watch and act for a residential area in Dunsborough, in Western Australia's South West.

title.children: Blaze burning in Dunsborough threatening homes but warnings downgraded

image.altText: Justin Williams, with short peroxide white hair and short facial hair, looks without smiling into camera in art gallery.

props.synopsis: Australian artist Justin Williams explores themes of parenthood, familial histories, mythology and isolation in his 2025 solo exhibition, Waiting for Lavender.

title.children: Becoming a dad changed this artist in unexpected ways

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The government of Nauru will settle members of the NZYQ cohort, according to Australian Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke.

title.children: Nauru to take non-citizen NZYQ cohort freed from immigration detention

image.altText: Crashed cars in the Hunter Valley after an alleged illegal street race

props.synopsis:
NSW Police and emergency services were called to Bromage Road at Abermain, near Cessnock, just after midnight on Saturday following reports of a crash.

title.children: Two children among six people hit by car that crashed after alleged burnout

image.altText: Joaquin Niemann waves his hat to the crowd as CHAMPION is visible on the big screen

props.synopsis: Chile's Joaquin Niemann fires a seven-under final round to win LIV Golf's Adelaide tournament by two strokes from Mexico's Abraham Ancer, with Marc Leishman the best-placed Australian.

title.children: Niemann wins LIV Adelaide as Aussie team fails to fire

image.altText: Empty meat fridge at Coles in Broome.

props.synopsis: Supermarket shelves in WA's north-west left empty after record-breaking rainfall from Tropical Cyclone Zelia forces the closure of major transport routes in the region.Â

title.children: Supermarket shelves stripped bare as major roads closed in wake of Cyclone Zelia

image.altText: A Ukrainian howitzer vehicle travels towards the camera on a windy dirt road

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Europe can no longer count on the US for support and it should create an "armed forces of Europe" to defend itself.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls for 'armed forces of Europe' as US pulls back support

image.altText: Tennis player Jannik Sinner wears a white jumper and shows off a watch on his left wrist at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Jannik Sinner and the whole doping system's lack of transparency are under fire from across the tennis world after the world number one strikes a deal to accept a three-month ban from WADA.

title.children: 'I don't believe in a clean sport': Major winner on Sinner's doping ban

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Nobody is suggesting the prime minister needlessly antagonise the US president but whether he likes it or not, Anthony Albanese's future on tariffs is in Donald Trump's hands.Â

title.children: Play stupid games, win stupid prizes: Albanese's Trump tariff 'test' an insult

image.altText: Passengers jostle with each other to board a train

props.synopsis: People trying to board a train bound for the Hindu Maha Kumbh festival are caught in a crowd crush, which leaves many pilgrims dead.

title.children: Stampede at Indian railway station kills Maha Kumbh festival pilgrims

image.altText: Woman in white three-quarter sleeve dress seated with hand on knee of her partner, a man in jeans and shirt. They sit outside

props.synopsis: When Laura and Colin's partners died suddenly from the same condition, they were shocked to find themselves falling in love while still grieving.

title.children: When widower Col found new love, he never expected to lose friends over it

image.altText: Blue and white police tape at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Crime squad detectives are investigating two separate armed robbery sprees that took place in the city's east and south-east last night.

title.children: Three service station staff assaulted during crime sprees in Melbourne

image.altText: Hnin Win stares into the camera lens wearing a red cast on her arm.

props.synopsis: Burmese Australian activist Hnin Win never really understood her father until after Myanmar's military overthrew the country's democratically elected government.

title.children: Hnin never got on with her dad. Then Myanmar's coup happened

image.altText: An Archbishop sits next to a caucasian man in a black suit at a table with notes in front of them

props.synopsis: Catholic Education Tasmania told a parliamentary inquiry that someone in a gay or de facto relationship would not be promoted to senior leadership positions within its schools. Equality Tasmania is concerned that it breaches state anti-discrimination laws.Â

title.children: LGBTQIA+ Catholic school staff overlooked for key roles, inquiry hears
